revised_title: Tide Observations and Inequalities at Bristol
tldr: This paper discusses the author's attempt to discover the laws of diurnal and solar inequalities in the times and heights of high water at the Port of Bristol using the Bristol Self-registering Tide-Gauge. The author presents the results of their observations, including the effects of lunar and solar parallax and declination, and the impact of these inequalities on the times and heights of high water.
